articles.title: Kim Jong Un Guides Actual Drill of KPA Combined Units
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Guides Actual Drill of KPA Combined Units
						
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army (KPA) Kim Jong Un, first secretary of  the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, guided an actual drill between KPA Large Combined Unit 526 and KPA Combined Unit 478.
					 He was greeted at the drill ground by KPA Vice Marshal Hwang Pyong So, director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA, Army General Hyon Yong Chol, minister of the People's Armed Forces, Army General Ri Yong Gil, chief of the KPA General Staff, and Army General Pyon In Son, first vice-chief of the General Staff and director of the Operation Bureau of the KPA.
					
					 Watching the drill were commanders of the services of the KPA, corps commanders, division commanders, brigade commanders and teachers of military universities at all levels. 
					
					 Kim Jong Un received a report on the plan of the drill at the observation post and guided the drill.
					
					 Combatants of Light Infantry Unit of Combined Unit 478 of the KPA put under control the defence lines at a lightning speed through a bold attack in order to overcome various obstacles laid by engineering units of Large Combined Unit 526 of the KPA and pave the way for mechanized units. Then units supporting the advancing forces conducted combat actions to destroy different kinds of obstacles.
					
					 "Helicopters" which had flown to check the advance of mechanized units were destroyed to pieces by precision strikes of shoulder-fired rockets and various type self-propelled artillery pieces of Combined Unit 478 of the KPA blew up targets by volley firing.
					
					 As the drill was over, Kim Jong Un analyzed the merits and demerits in the drill and set forth highly important tasks which would serve as guidelines for developing the KPA into the invincible revolutionary armed forces by intensifying the training just as the anti-Japanese guerillas did in Mt. Paektu.
					
					 Noting that the drill staged this time is of weighty significance in implementing the party's military and strategic policy, he instructed the KPA to frequently organize such drill as the commanding officers and staff officers have to use their brains a lot when similar actual drills are staged between the two sides.
					
					 He was accompanied by Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the Central Committee of the WPK, and O Il Jong, department director of the C.C., the WPK.

articles.title: Talks between Kim Yong Nam and Sudanese President
articles.content:
Talks between Kim Yong Nam and Sudanese President
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Talks between Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on an official goodwill visit to Sudan, and Omar Hassan Ahmed Al-Bashir, president of the Republic of Sudan, were held at the presidential palace Thursday.
					 At the talks, both sides exchanged views on the issue of developing the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries and other issues of mutual concern.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Arrives in Khartoum
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Arrives in Khartoum
						
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, arrived in Khartoum on Thursday to pay an official goodwill visit to Sudan.
					 Also arriving were Kang Ha Guk, minister of Public Health, Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, So Kil Bok, vice-minister of External Economic Relations, and other suite members.
					
					 A guard of honor lined up at the airport where flags of the DPRK and Sudan were fluttering.
					
					 Kim Yong Nam and his party were greeted by the speaker of the National Assembly, the chairman of the Diplomatic Affairs Committee of the National Assembly, the director for East Asia of the Foreign Ministry and other officials concerned and Kim Hyok Chol, DPRK ambassador to Sudan.
					
					 Kim Yong Nam headed for lodgings, escorted by motorcycles.

articles.title: Criminal Nature of Anti-DPRK Leaflet-Scattering Operations of U.S., S. Korea Laid Bare
articles.content:
Criminal Nature of Anti-DPRK Leaflet-Scattering Operations of U.S., S. Korea Laid Bare 
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- The National Reunification Institute released a white paper Friday exposing the criminal nature of the leaflet-scattering operations which the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces stage by instigating human scum.
					 The U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces are to blame for such a deplorable situation as today as they have escalated confrontation on the Korean peninsula and gave rise to the leaflet issue that has increased the danger of a war, the white paper says, and goes on:
					
					 During the Korean war in the past the U.S. formed psychological warfare units under the Command of the U.S. forces in the Far East and the Command of the 8th army and let them scatter anti-DPRK leaflets in different parts of Korea.
					
					 Anti-DPRK leaflets scattered by the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces in January 1952 alone numbered over 150 million.
					
					 The number of anti-DPRK leaflets scattered by the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces during the three-year war stood at more than 2 460 million, according to an official report and it reached a total of over 4 000 million if the number of those scattered by the south Korean puppet forces is added.
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces have become all the more undisguised in their leaflet-scattering operation after the war.
					
					 At the instigation of the U.S., the south Korean puppet forces organized many psychological warfare units in charge of scattering leaflets among forefront units and in the 1970s they conducted "leaflet balloon operation" for sending leaflets deeper into the rear of the DPRK side.
					
					 Even after the publication of the historic July 4 joint statement in 1972, the puppet forces did not stop the leaflet-scattering operation, in violation of the agreement on refraining from acts of slandering the other side.
					
					 Entering the 1980s, the south Korean puppet forces set up a unit for psychological warfare and leaflet-scattering under the army and in 1991 they reorganized the unit to put it directly under the Defense Ministry and set up a system for unified command of the anti-DPRK leaflet-scattering operation.
					
					 According to data on "psychological warfare toward the north" which was presented to "National Assembly" by the puppet Defense Ministry in 2011, the number of leaflets scattered in the areas of the DPRK from the 1980s to the end of the 1990s was more than 1 918 million.
					
					 The south Korean authorities could not directly take part in the operation after the adoption and publication of the historic June 15 joint declaration as an agreement was reached between the military authorities of the north and the south to stop all psychological warfare including leaflet-scattering operation and to end all other hostile acts. So they have resorted to crafty method of prodding the "defectors from the north", human scum, and ultra-right conservative organizations into the operation.
					
					 In October 2003, Ri Min Bok took part in scattering leaflets under the mask of the representative of the Association of North Korean Christians. Plot-breeding organizations made up of human scum such as the Headquarters for the Movement for Democratic North, the Alliance for the Movement of Free North, the General Association of Organizations of Defectors from the North and the Association for Promotion of Democracy in the North made their appearances and buckled down to leaflet-scattering operation.
					
					 The operation has become all the more undisguised during the Lee Myung Bak regime.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group nullified all the north-south agreements on ending all hostile acts including mud-slinging and made leaflet-scattering a priority task in realizing its "policy toward the north".
					
					 The puppet army resumed anti-DPRK psychological warfare including broadcasting and leaflet-scattering operation. Equipment for releasing more than 80 000 sheets of leaflets a day was developed to be deployed in the forefront units.
					
					 An official concerned of the puppet army said at that time that "there were more than 1 300 kinds of original copies of leaflets and over 470 kinds of broadcasting scripts for psychological warfare against the north during war".
					
					 The Lee group brought more than 20 wicked deserters including Hong Sun Gyong, chairman of the Committee for Democracy of the North, An Chan Il, president of the World Federation of North Koreans and Kim Hung Gwang, representative of the Solidarity of NK Intellectuals and Pak Sang Hak, representative of the Alliance for the Movement of Free North, to Chongwadae in January 2011 and promised them aid fund for leaflet-scattering while wining and dining them. The puppet forces have massively funded human scum in their leaflet-scattering operation after earmarking more than 100 million U.S. dollars for supporting "defectors from the north" every year.
					
					 The budget allocated for leaflet-scattering operations amounted to 200 000 U.S. dollars from 2011 to July 2012.
					
					 Under the present regime, the anti-DPRK leaflet-scattering operation has become all the more undisguised to put the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors into the shade.
					
					 The present chief executive of south Korea sent a congratulatory message to the Association for Promotion of Democracy in the North comprising wicked deserters who took the lead in scattering anti-DPRK leaflets in October 2012 even before taking office as "president" only to be denounced by the public. After taking office, she invited to Chongwadae and encouraged human scum who had worked with bloodshot eyes for leaflet-scattering.
					
					 She even posted human scum of anti-DPRK plot-breeding organizations such as the Committee for Democracy of the North, the Solidarity of NK Intellectuals and the Center for Strategy toward the North to the "Committee for Great Unity of People" and the "Committee for Preparations for Unification" which are directly under the "president", prodding them into action.
					
					 The puppet forces even developed a satellite air navigation device to be mounted on balloons for scattering leaflets, a program for controlling balloons to suit the wind direction and speed and the technology of radio transmission system for sending e-leaflets into the rear of the DPRK side, and have provided them free to human scum.
					
					 Even though they agreed to stop slandering the other side at the first round of the north-south high-level contact in February, the conservative puppet forces have continued scattering leaflets. They even mull developing and deploying new leaflet-scattering shell to be fired from K-9 self-propelled gun in order to send leaflets farther into the rear of the DPRK side.
					
					 The U.S. actively supports the operation, openly saying that such psychological warfare as leaflet-scattering is an effective means for disintegrating and overthrowing the DPRK.
					
					 As the spirit of reconciliation and reunification mounted between the north and the south after the adoption of the June 15 joint declaration, the U.S. organized together with the puppet forces the "combined command for psychological warfare" and introduced EC-130 special plane known as a "flying broadcasting station" and a unit specializing in psychological warfare as part of its stepped-up anti-DPRK psychological warfare. 
					
					 The U.S. also instituted the "Act on Free North" aimed at "regime change" and let "defectors from the north" take the lead in conducting smear campaign against the DPRK.
					
					 In April 2006 and September 2008 the then U.S. President Bush met Kim Song Min and Pak Sang Hak who are representatives of the Radio Free North Korea and the Alliance for the Movement of Free North and egged them on to leaflet-scattering operation while praising them as "outpost soldiers for expansion of freedom". In February this year the U.S. invited Pak Sang Hak and Kang Chol Hwan, representative of the Center for Strategy toward the North, to the Silicon Valley and showed them technology for disseminating USB, DVD and other media to the area of the DPRK side through GPS.
					
					 In July it staged a contest of information and telecommunications technology for breaking through the information network of the north in a worldwide scale with the attendance of the defectors and handed over to them ultra-modern development data for conducting anti-DPRK smear psychological campaign.
					
					 The U.S. even stipulated in the OPLAN 5029 an article calling for making the north collapse by changing the understanding of the north Korean citizens through NGOs. To this end, it has financed organizations made up of "defectors from the north" through its NGOs like the State Democratic Fund, Alliance for Free North and Human Rights Watch.
					
					 The State Democratic Fund whose mission is to overthrow the governments of anti-U.S. states has increasingly funded organizations made up of "defectors from the north": 1.21 million U.S. dollars in 2007, 1.27 million U.S. dollars in 2008, 1.4 million U.S. dollars in 2009 and 1.45 million U.S. dollars in 2010.
					
					 The U.S. State Department has also funded the Network for Democratic North, Radio for Free North Korea, Solidarity of Women Defectors from North for Rights, etc. more than one million U.S. dollars each year starting from 2009.
					
					 By spending over 20 million U.S. dollars for human scum each year, the U.S. instigated them to hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK, its social system and human rights not only in south Korea and the U.S. but also on the UN arena.
					
					 The "defectors from the north" who joined all sorts of plot-breeding organizations such as the Headquarters for Movement for Democratic North, the Alliance for the Movement of Free North, the Association of North Korean Christians scatter more than 10 million leaflets on a yearly average.
					
					 The defectors whom the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces instigate to anti-DPRK campaign by painting them as "human rights fighters" are group of criminals and betes noires who should not be left intact in society in the light of law.
					
					 So great is the catastrophic impact the anti-DPRK leaflet-scattering operation has on the north-south relations.
					
					 The anti-DPRK smear campaign conducted by the vicious "defectors from the north" under the patronage and manipulation of the U.S. and the south Korean puppet authorities are a serious act of provoking a war as it is in violation of the Armistice Agreement and the north-south agreements.
					
					 The U.S. should feel ashamed of the fact that the dollar symbolic of its sovereignty is being misused for smear campaign by human scum.
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean puppet authorities should immediately stop leaflet-scattering operations, clearly understanding the catastrophic consequences to be entailed by their anti-DPRK plot-breeding racket.

articles.title: Chairman of German-Korean Parliamentary Group Arrives
articles.content:
Chairman of German-Korean Parliamentary Group Arrives
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Hartmut Koschyk, chairman of the German-Korean Parliamentary Group, and his party arrived here Friday.

articles.title: Minister of Development of Far East of Russia Leaves
articles.content:
Minister of Development of Far East of Russia Leaves
						
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Alexandr Galushka, minister of Development of Far East of Russia who doubles as chairman of the Russian side to the Inter-Governmental Committee for Cooperation in Trade, Economy, Science and Technology between the DPRK and Russia, and his party left here Friday.
					 During their visit, they looked round the Kaesong Industrial Zone, the Chongjin area, etc. and enjoyed a performance given by artistes of the National Folk Art Troupe at the Ponghwa Art Theatre.

articles.title: Reception Given by U.N. Resident Coordinator and Resident Representative of UNDP
articles.content:
Reception Given by U.N. Resident Coordinator and Resident Representative of UNDP
						
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Ghulam M. Isaczai, U.N. resident coordinator and resident representative of the UNDP to DPRK, gave a reception Friday on the occasion of the Day of the United Nations.
					 Present there on invitation were Pak Myong Guk, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, officials concerned, diplomatic envoys of different countries here.
					
					 Representatives of international organizations here were present.
					
					Speeches were made at the reception.

articles.title: Gold Medalists, Coaches Commended in DPRK
articles.content:
Gold Medalists, Coaches Commended in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- The eye-opening successes made by sportspersons of the DPRK at the 17th Asian Games and world championships are a great victory which fully demonstrated the dignity and spirit of the great Kim Il Sung's nation and Kim Jong Il's Korea before the whole world and the shining fruit of the plan of the Workers' Party of Korea on building a sports powerhouse and its idea of attaching importance to sports.
					 With the firm resolution and steadfast will to raise a hot wind of sports across the country and rapidly develop sports technique to put the DPRK on the position of a sports powerhouse, Marshal Kim Jong Un clearly indicated the orientation and ways of developing sports and energetically led sportspersons, taking good care of them with warm love and trust.
					
					 The dependable sportspersons of the DPRK, burning their hearts with intense loyalty to the Marshal and warm patriotism, won matches with pluck and methods provided by the party, strong fighting will and indomitable mental power, instilling conviction of sure victory and optimism into all service personnel and people and greatly encouraging their drive to build a rich and powerful nation.
					
					 Gold medalists and coaches were commended in the DPRK.
					
					 Kim Jong Il Prize was awarded to Kim Un Guk, wrestler of the April 25 Sports Team, Om Yun Chol, wrestler of the Amnokgang Sports Team, the title of Labor Hero to Kim Kwang Min, football coach of the April 25 Sports Team, Pak Ki Song, wrestling coach of the April 25 Sports Team, and Ra Un Sim, footballer of the Amnokgang Sports  Team, the title of People's Sportsperson to Ho Un Byol, footballer of the April 25 Sports Team, and Order of National Flag First Class to Ri Se Gwang, gymnast of the April 25 Sports Team. 
					
					 A decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly was promulgated on Oct. 22.

articles.title: Yonphung Scientists Rest Home Opens
articles.content:
Yonphung Scientists Rest Home Opens
						
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- The Scientists Rest Home was successfully built on the picturesque shore of Lake Yonphung.
					 The rest home houses general service center, multi-purpose outdoor sporting ground, indoor and outdoor wading pools, video room and angling site whose architectural composition and elements are all new in form and content.
					
					 A ceremony of completion took place Friday.
					
					 Present there were Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, officials of the State Academy of Sciences, scientists, soldier-builders and employees of the rest home.
					
					 Choe Thae Bok, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the WPK, made an address. He said:
					
					 The best rest home for scientists was built in the wake of the successful completion of Wisong Scientists Residential Quarter. This is the proud result produced by the idea of Marshal Kim Jong Un on attaching importance to science and talents.
					
					 There are many important construction projects in different parts of the country as it wages the drive for building a thriving nation, but Kim Jong Un made sure that the scientists rest home was built before others. 
					
					 The speaker called upon all the Koreans to turn out in a dynamic struggle to build the best thriving nation and people's paradise by dint of science and technology on this land, upholding the WPK's idea of attaching importance to science and talents.
					
					 At the end of the ceremony, the participants looked round the rest home.

articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Bust of O Paek Ryong
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid before Bust of O Paek Ryong
						
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were laid before the bust of revolutionary martyr O Paek Ryong at the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong on Friday on the occasion of the centenary of his birth.
					 Seen standing before the bust was a wreath sent by Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were Choe Ryong Hae, Hyon Yong Chol, Vice-Premier Kim Yong Jin, officials of party, armed forces and power organs, service personnel, bereaved family members and other people in the city.
					
					 Amid the playing of the wreath-laying music wreaths were laid before the bust in the name of the Central Committee of the WPK, the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK and the DPRK Cabinet.
					
					 Also placed were wreaths in the name of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, units of the Korean People's Army and party and power bodies in the city and bounches of flowers.
					
					 The participants observed a moment's silence in memory of the martyr.

articles.title: DPRK People Recall Life of Veteran Revolutionary
articles.content:
DPRK People Recall Life of Veteran Revolutionary
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Today marks the birth anniversary of O Paek Ryong, a veteran revolutionary in Korea who devoted all his life to safeguarding the leader.
					 Born into a poor peasant's family in Hoeryong County, North Hamgyong Province of Korea on October 24, Juche 3 (1914), O Paek Ryong embarked on the road of revolutionary struggle in his early years.
					
					 At the age of 17, he took part in the actions to capture weapons under the policy of waging an armed struggle against the Japanese aggressors advanced by President Kim Il Sung. Then he joined the Korean People's Revolutionary Army and dedicated his all to defending the headquarters of the revolution.
					
					 After Korea's liberation from Japan's colonial rule in August 15, 1945 and in the period of the Fatherland Liberation War (1950-1953), he had worked hard at important posts for building regular armed forces and a new country and for victory in the war.
					
					 Later, he did his utmost at responsible party, state and military posts, regarding it as his life mission to devotedly safeguard the leader of the Korean revolution.
					
					 He had been always faithful to President Kim Il Sung, who taught him Korean alphabet and trained him as an able military officer, and made a significant contribution to giving continuity to the lineage of the Korean revolution started in Mt. Paektu under the guidance of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Kim Jong Il in his lifetime had shown loving care for O Paek Ryong and his family, putting him forward as a veteran and backbone of the Korean revolution.
					
					 Thanks to such deep trust and loving care, O Paek Ryong remains alive in the hearts of the Korean people forever as a model vanguard fighter defending the leader.

articles.title: National Sci-Tech Presentation of Printing Field Held
articles.content:
National Sci-Tech Presentation of Printing Field Held
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- A national sci-tech presentation of the printing field took place at the Pyongyang General Printing Plant on October 23 and 24.
					 Present there were officials, scientists, technicians, teachers, researchers and postgraduates in the printing field.
					
					 The participants heard at least 70 papers presented by the Pyongyang General Printing Plant, Pyongyang City Printing Plant, Pyongyang Trademark Printing Plant, Publishing and Printing Science Institute, Pyongyang University of Printing and other units.
					
					 Introduced at the presentation were achievements and experience made in putting printing plants on a modern and IT basis and improving quality of publications.
					
					 Papers presented by Pyongyang General Printing Plant, Publishing and Printing Science Institute and Pyongyang University of Printing were highly appreciated for their realistic significance.

articles.title: Apple Show Held
articles.content:
Apple Show Held
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- A show took place here on Friday to taste apples produced at fruit farms of the DPRK this year.
					 Presented there were at least 20 kinds of apples produced at the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm, Kosan Fruit Farm and fruit farms in Kwail County.
					
					 Sweet taste, sour taste, aroma and juice of varieties of apples were assessed by the method of public examination.

articles.title: 45th Sports Contest of Artistes Held
articles.content:
45th Sports Contest of Artistes Held
						
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- The 45th sports contest of artistes took place at the Kim Il Sung Stadium on Friday.
					 The contest is being held every year under the deep concern of officials, creators and artistes in the field of culture and arts. It clearly proves the validity and vitality of the policy of the Workers' Party of Korea on mass sports.
					
					 The contest was divided into the film art, stage art and fine art groups. The groups competed in football, basketball, volleyball, athletics, tug of war and other events.
					
					 The film art group placed first in total points.

articles.title: Hills and Fields Relay Held
articles.content:
Hills and Fields Relay Held
						
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- A hills and fields relay took place recently on Moran Hill in Pyongyang with the attendance of over 350 male and female marathoners from at least 30 sports teams, the first of its kind in the DPRK.
					 The course was covering 5km-long uphill and 4km-long downhill.
					
					 The Amnokgang Sports Team took the first place in men's relay and the April 25 Sports Team in women's.
					
					 Jong Song Ok, secretary of the DPRK Marathon Association, told KCNA that the relay was conducive to raising the physical ability of marathoners, announcing that the association will organize such relay on a regular basis.

articles.title: New-type Solar Follower Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
New-type Solar Follower Developed in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- The Mechanical Engineering Institute of the State Academy of Sciences in the DPRK has recently developed a new kind of solar follower, conducive to increasing the utilization of solar energy.
					 This mechanism makes it possible for tens of solar panels at once to follow the sunlight vertically all the time. According to the results of its application, it helps raise the power output 1.3 times than before.
					
					 The device won a high appreciation at the 13th National Exhibition of Inventions and New Technologies.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Urges South Korean Authorities to Behave Themselves
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Urges South Korean Authorities to Behave Themselves
						
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- The dramatic development of the process for improving the inter-Korean relations thanks to the bold decision, magnanimity and sincere efforts of the DPRK has reached the brink of frustration some days later, Rodong Sinmun Friday says in a commentary, adding: This is  attributable to the south Korean authorities' incoherent attitude. 
					 They are getting evermore pronounced in their anti-reunification confrontation racket just little over two weeks after high-ranking officials of the north and the south promised to improve the relations, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 The prevailing situation reminds one of the situation right after the publication of the historic July 4 joint statement when the "yusin" dictator of south Korea desperately kicked up a confrontation racket, crying out for  "all-out security" and "establishment of a war posture" under the signboard of "confrontation accompanied by dialogue" and "rivalry accompanied by dialogue." The dictator blustered that they could neither entrust their fate to a few pieces of paper nor trust them.
					
					 The implementation of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, both adopted at the north-south summits in the new century, was suspended due to the insincere moves of the south Korean authorities to renege on them.
					
					 The nation's desire for mending the inter-Korean relations and the reunification was mercilessly dampened due to acts of treachery committed by a handful of traitors. What does this reality show? 
					
					 It proves that no matter what good agreement is reached between the north and the south, it is bound to be brought to naught as long as the south seeks a sinister aim, not giving up its wild ambition for confrontation.
					
					 This is a serious lesson taught by the history of the inter-Korean relations which has undergone twists and turns because of successive confrontation-seeking regimes in south Korea.
					
					 The inter-Korean relations are now standing at the crucial crossroads:  Whether to make the seeds of the hard-won dialogue sprout or push them to an uncontrollable catastrophe.
					
					 The south Korean authorities would be well advised to properly understand the gravity of the situation and behave themselves.

articles.title: Day of United Nations Marked
articles.content:
Day of United Nations Marked
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Papers Friday in articles dedicated to the Day of the United Nations say the reform of the UN Security Council is an urgent issue whose solution brooks no further delay.
					  The UN is a world body founded for the purpose of preventing  humankind from suffering again such war disaster as the Second World War, says Rodong Sinmun.
					
					 Different countries of the world are showing increasing concern and expectation toward the U.N. in the light of its mission and duty. To our regret, the U.N. fails to strictly abide by the principle of its activities.
					
					 There is increasing urgency to ensure world peace and security through the U.N. positive activities. It is necessary to democratize the UN and successfully meet the challenges to the UN Charter in order to ensure justice, impartiality and equality in the UN mechanism system and activities.
					
					 The reform of the UNSC is, in essence, the work to democratize the UN and international relations.
					
					 The UN should not turn its face away from the trend of the era towards putting an end to wars that bring misfortune and pain to the earth.
					
					 The respect for sovereignty, equal sovereignty and principle of non-interference in internal affairs enshrined in the UN Charter are now openly disregarded at the UNSC and "resolutions" which justify and legalize the U.S. policy for world domination are being railroaded through it.
					
					 The reform of the UNSC should be carried out on the principle of thoroughly ensuring the responsibility, impartiality and objectivity in its activities and fully guaranteeing the representation of the developing countries in the composition.
					
					 Minju Joson says that the U.N. should lend an ear to the demand of the international community and make a firm decision in reforming the UNSC.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary on "Initiative for Northeast Asia Peace and Cooperation"
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary on "Initiative for Northeast Asia Peace and Cooperation"
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- A forum for "2014 Initiative for Northeast Asia Peace and Cooperation" is reportedly slated to be held in Seoul late in October. 
					 KCNA cannot but re-clarify its stand on this matter as the ruling quarters in south Korea deceived the international community, creating the impression that they promoted the peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula and worked for the reunification of Korea under the signboard of "Initiative for Northeast Asia Peace and Cooperation" in the past. 
					
					  The present chief executive of south Korea frequently peddled this initiative, talking about peace in Northeast Asia even before becoming the "president".
					
					 This initiative, in a nutshell, calls on the regional countries to begin with building confidence by cooperating in less sensitive issues and, furthermore, to form a multi-party security cooperation framework involving all the countries in Northeast Asia where economic inter- dependence is increasing whereas acute conflicts exist in security matters. 
					
					 But a scrutiny into the initiative proves that it is unrealistic as it completely ignores the present situation in Northeast Asia and the south Korean authorities seek a sinister political purpose through it as it is nothing but a blind copy of the mode of integration in Europe which sharply differs from the Northeast Asian region in the political, social and historical backgrounds.  
					
					 Wall Street Journal on Nov. 12, 2012 carried an article titled "Initiative for Northeast Asia Peace and Cooperation" contributed by Park Geun Hye. 
					
					 Park said in the article that the continued U.S. presence in Northeast Asia is an "important factor of contributing to the regional peace and prosperity and the DPRK's dismantlement of nukes is a "sure way of building new Northeast Asia and ushering in an Asian century".
					
					 Herein lies the deceptive and reactionary nature of the initiative.
					
					 The initiative is the U.S.-south Korea joint product aimed at the DPRK's "dismantlement of nukes" and "unification through absorption". The projected forum is part of the initiative.
					
					 The initiative is unanimously censured and condemned by the public at home and abroad as the south Korean regime seeks "unification through absorption under liberal democracy" by playing the role of an advance party and shock brigade in carrying out the U.S. hostile policy to disarm the dignified DPRK and bring down its socialist system.
					
					 In the 21st century the world strategic pivot is being shifted to Asia-Pacific and, accordingly, the military strategic pivot is being transferred to Northeast Asia.
					
					 The U.S. made a policy switchover from Europe to Asia-Pacific. It is intensifying its political, economic and military intervention in Asia-Pacific, advocating the theory of a Pacific state.
					
					 To this end, the U.S. is beefing up its forces as required by its new regional strategy and pivot strategy and taking frequent military actions to secure an unchallenged military edge in this region, while keeping the Cold War mechanism there.
					
					 The most acute hostile relations exist between the DPRK and U.S. in Northeast Asia at present. A touch-and-go situation prevails there.
					
					 The U.S. hostile policy towards the DPRK remains unchanged though the bosses of the White House were replaced often from Truman, the architect of the Korean division, to Obama.
					
					 The U.S. hostile policy towards the DPRK has been amended and supplemented with harsher contents.
					
					 The U.S. policy to stifle and isolate the DPRK politically, economically and militarily and its actions have reached a more dangerous phase.
					
					 The moves stepped up by the U.S. to tighten sanctions and isolate and blockade the DPRK and escalate its military threats against the DPRK   over its nuclear deterrence are driving the situation on the peninsula to the brink of war. The "human rights" racket against the DPRK has gone beyond the danger line.
					
					 The U.S. is systemically beefing up its forces in Northeast Asia in a bid to ignite another Korean war while reducing forces in other regions of the world.
					
					 The U.S. hostile policy towards the DPRK is the harshest policy to bring down the ideology and social system with American-style democracy and market economy and swallow up the whole nation and land of Korea by force of arms through aggression.
					
					 The U.S. labeled the DPRK "provoker and dangerous entity" to attain this policy goal and is busy escalating the "sanctions, isolation and blockade" against the DPRK by whipping together undesirable forces.
					
					 The nuclear issue on the peninsula remains unsettled, situation deteriorates periodically and tension escalates due to the DPRK-U.S. hostile relations, source of mistrust and confrontation.
					
					 The termination of DPRK-U.S. hostile relations is the most urgent for ensuring peace in Northeast Asia.
					
					 The DPRK has worked hard for peace, proceeding from the requirements of its domestic and foreign policies.
					
					 Nothing is dearer to us than a peaceful environment and tension is harmful to us.
					
					 The U.S., south Korea and other anti-DPRK forces claim that the situation on the peninsula remains tense due to the DPRK's nukes but it was none other than the U.S. which compelled the DPRK to have access to nukes.
					
					 The DPRK's decision to have access to nuclear deterrence was an inevitable one, unable to live any longer in face of the U.S. hostile policy, military pressure and nuclear blackmail over half a century since its foundation.
					
					 The DPRK's nukes serve as a means of deterring a war. The DPRK didn't have access to them to harm or threaten someone.
					
					 The acute situation on the peninsula created due to the U.S. moves to stifle the DPRK is like a time-bomb posing constant threat to the peace and security in Northeast Asia.
					
					 If a war breaks out on the peninsula, it will cause a chain reaction and develop into a regional war.
					
					 What is the most urgent for ensuring security in Northeast Asia is to settle the hostile relations between the DPRK and U.S. and defuse the military confrontation.
					
					 There would be no regional peace and cooperation without doing this.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Slammed for Extending Transfer of Right to Wartime Operation Control
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Slammed for Extending Transfer of Right to Wartime Operation Control
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Members of 50 organizations of south Korea including the People's Action for Peace against War and the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification held a joint press conference outside the Ministry of Defense on Oct. 22 opposing the moves to extend the transfer of the right to wartime operation control (OPECON).
					 A press release was read out there.
					
					 It accused the south Korean military authorities of requesting foreign forces to extend the transfer of the right to OPECON.
					
					 The U.S. is mulling keeping hold on the right in a bid to operate missile defence system in which south Korea and Japan would take part and push forward the formation of the triangular military alliance in its interests and thus hold hegemony in Northeast Asia, it said.
					
					 It urged the south Korean authorities to take over the right immediately and stop the moves for concluding a military agreement with Japan.
					
					 At the end of the press conference the organizations thrust the papers signed by more than 20 000 persons against Japan's rearming and the conclusion of a military agreement between south Korea and Japan to the Ministry of Defense and U.S. and Japanese embassies in Seoul.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Its Moves for Retrogressive Reform of Pension
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Its Moves for Retrogressive Reform of Pension
						
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Voice of People, an internet paper of south Korea, in an editorial on Oct. 23 accused the authorities of its moves for retrogressive reform of the pension for the government employees.
					 The editorial said that the "government" is pushing ahead with the reform of pension for government employees in the direction of cutting it down.
					
					 It accused the "Saenuri Party" of trying to pass the bill on pension within the year.
					
					 Chaos and contradiction are being created between the "government" and government employees over pension reform, it said, adding:
					
					  We can never accept the bill on pension reform which the "government" and the "Saenuri Party" push ahead under the pretext of financial stability.

articles.title: Meeting of Movement for Supporting Korea's Reunification Held in Japan
articles.content:
Meeting of Movement for Supporting Korea's Reunification Held in Japan
						
 Tokyo, October 23 (KNS-KCNA) -- The 32nd national meeting of the movement for supporting Korea's reunification was held in Hokkaido, Japan on Oct. 19.
					 Present there were Fumihiro Himori, chairman of the Japan Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, and members of its committee, members of the executive committee of the national meeting and representatives of organizations for solidarity with the Korean people.
					
					 Present there on invitation were Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), and other officials of Chongryon.
					
					 A congratulatory message sent by the Korean Society for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries to the meeting was read out.
					
					 Kenji Mizutani, general secretary of the Japan Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, made a keynote report.
					
					 He said that the Japanese authorities should take a sincere attitude towards settling the issues of building confidence and improving relations between the two countries, promptly lift the sanctions against the DPRK and opt for holding talks for normalizing bilateral relations.
					
					 Their visits to Yasukuni Shrine and revival of Japan's militarism, distortion of history and evasion of blame for its past crimes can never be tolerated, he said, expressing the will to conduct positive activities to guarantee the human rights of Koreans in Japan.
					
					 Then followed a seminar on the theme of "For achieving peace in Northeast Asia through normalization of Japan-DPRK relations and north-south reunification!"
					
					 The seminar discussed the prospect for DPRK-Japan relations and north-south relations and tasks for improving them.
					
					 An appeal was adopted at the meeting. It supported the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea. It urged the south Korean authorities to sincerely implement the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and the Japanese authorities to come out for the talks for normalizing relations with the DPRK at an early date.

articles.title: Anniversary of DIU Marked in Guinea
articles.content:
Anniversary of DIU Marked in Guinea
						
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Lecture and film shows took place in Guinea on Oct 14 and 16 on the occasion of the 88th anniversary of the formation of the Down-with-Imperialism Union (DIU).
					 Displayed at the venues of the events were photos documenting the undying exploits President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un performed in building and leading the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					
					 Films shown included Korean films "Fireworks of a Thriving Nation" and "Pyongyang Today."
					
					 Present at the events were personages and masses from all walks of life in Guinea.
					
					 The chairman of the Guinean Society for the Study of the Juche Literary Idea in a lecture titled "DIU and WPK" referred to the significance of the formation of the DIU.
					
					 He said:
					
					 The revolutionary cause of Juche started by Kim Il Sung is dynamically advancing along the road of independence, Songun and socialism. 
					
					 The history of the Korean revolution is characterized by the victory won along the road pioneered by the DIU. 
					
					 Glory will always be in store for the WPK advancing along the path of independence, Songun and socialism. 
					
					 The chief of the administration and construction of a general company of Guinea noted that Kim Il Sung formed the DIU on Oct. 17, 1926, making it possible for the Korean revolution to make a new start and the Korean people to advance along the correct road.
					
					 The chief of the public work of the same company said after watching a film that the DPRK is shedding its rays to the whole world thanks to the guidance of the great party.

articles.title: Russian Media Observe WPK's Founding Anniversary
articles.content:
Russian Media Observe WPK's Founding Anniversary
						
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Russian papers and websites posted special write-ups from Oct. 6 to 15, illustrated with portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and their photos and pictures of Marshal Kim Jong Un on the occasion of the 69th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK). 
					 The paper Rio Panorama in its article titled "Down-with-Imperialism Union and the WPK" said that victory and glory are in store for the WPK dynamically advancing along the road of independence, Songun and socialism.
					
					 The paper Pravda Primoriya in an article titled "To remain true to socialism" introduced the ever-victorious history of the WPK guided by Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism based on the Juche idea, Songun idea.
					
					 The paper Byvor in an article titled "By putting people's living standard before anything else" noted that Kim Jong Il made a long journey out of his love for the people during the whole period of his leadership over the party and opened a turning phase for building a thriving nation on the land of Korea.
					
					 The paper Nakhodkinski Rabochi carried an article titled "To translate people's dream into reality."
					
					 The paper Komsomolskaya Pravda in an article titled "Rare leadership art, the DPRK builds a thriving nation" stressed that the DPRK would rise as a thriving nation in the near future as it is led by Kim Jong Un who is possessed of rare leadership art.
					
					 The websites of Irkutsk and the Tynda Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism also posted articles praising the exploits Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il performed in building and leading the party.

articles.title: Uzbek Personages Pay Congratulatory Visit to DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Uzbek Personages Pay Congratulatory Visit to DPRK Embassy
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Delegates of the Uzbekistan-DPRK Friendship Forum paid a congratulatory visit to the DPRK in Tashkent on Oct. 10 on the occasion of the 69th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 They laid bunches of flowers before the full-length portrait of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and paid tribute to them.
					
					 The chairman of the forum praised Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il as great leaders of the Korean people as they wisely led the WPK to play a vanguard role in the drive for the prosperity of the country and happiness of its people.
					
					 Now the WPK is achieving unprecedented successes in strengthening defense capability and building economy, he said, adding that this is unthinkable apart from revolutionary and popular work style and energetic guidance of Marshal Kim Jong Un who is successfully carrying forward the cause of the preceding leaders and their traits as great men.
					
					 He expressed belief that the Korean people would surely build on the land of Korea a thriving nation to startle the world under the leadership of Kim Jong Un despite all sorts of difficulties and ordeals.

articles.title: U.S. Anti-DPRK Human Rights Moves Denounced by Nepalese Figure
articles.content:
U.S. Anti-DPRK Human Rights Moves Denounced by Nepalese Figure
						
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- Narayan Man Bijukchhe, chairman of the Central Committee of the Nepal Worker-Peasant Party, in his speech made at the meeting of the Constituent Assembly on Oct. 17 branded the U.S. as the worst human rights abuser in the world and accused its human rights moves against the DPRK.
					 He said:
					
					 The U.S. is forcing the independent states in the world to accept its view on value. It has applied unreasonable sanctions and put pressure on those countries which refuse to accept it by taking issue with their "human rights".
					
					 Still unabated, however, are the human rights abuses by the U.S. and other Western countries.
					
					 The U.S., in particular, is the world's worst human rights abuser.
					
					 It is getting more undisguised in its moves to stifle the independent DPRK.
					
					 This has laid a stumbling block in the socio-economic development and the improvement of the people's living.
					
					 The Korean peninsula is still technically at war.
					
					 A peace agreement has not been concluded and a war may break out any moment on the peninsula due to the U.S. 
					
					 The U.S. ceaseless moves to stifle the DPRK are the most wanton violation and challenge to the sovereignty and democratic development of the DPRK and to the rights of its people.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il Praised by Peruvian Organization
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il Praised by Peruvian Organization
						
 Pyongyang, October 24 (KCNA) -- The Peruvian Committee for Remembering Generalissimo Kim Jong Il made public a statement on Oct. 9 on the occasion of the 17th anniversary of his election as general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), the 69th anniversary of its founding and the 88th anniversary of the formation of the Down-with-Imperialism Union (DIU).
					 The statement said:
					
					 October 10 is the founding anniversary of the WPK, guiding force of the struggle for independence against imperialism and socialism.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung formed the DIU in October of 1926 and it became the historical roots of the glorious WPK.
					
					 He, who defeated the Japanese imperialists and liberated the country, founded the WPK, general staff of the revolution, and strengthened the leadership over the party in every way, leading to victory the Fatherland Liberation War, postwar reconstruction and socialist construction. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il developed in depth the revolutionary idea of Kim Il Sung and wisely led the WPK to defend socialism and preserve revolutionary principle with his Songun politics.
					
					 Their exploits for leading the revolutionary party-building will be remembered long.
					
					 Now the WPK is fully demonstrating its might as an ever-victorious party, a mother party loved by the popular masses, under the outstanding guidance of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Victory and glory are always in store for the WPK, vanguard unit of the revolution and construction and a paragon of world revolutionary political parties.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un dirige ejercicios mutuos entre las unidades del EPC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un dirige ejercicios mutuos entre las unidades del EPC
						
Pyongyang, 24 de octubre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio los ejercicios mutuos entre la gran unidad combinada 526 y la unidad combinada 478 del EPC.
					Le recibieron en el campo de entrenamiento el vicemariscal del EPC, Hwang Pyong So, jefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC, el general de ejercito de las fuerzas terrestres del EPC, Hyon Yong Chol, ministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, el general de ejercito de las fuerzas terrestres del EPC, Ri Yong Gil, jefe del Estado Mayor General del EPC, y el general de ejercito de las fuerzas terrestres del EPC, Pyon In Son, primer subjefe del EMG del EPC y director de su buro de operaciones.
					
					Vieron los ejercicios los comandantes de los tipos de ejercito, los jefes de los cuerpos de ejercito, divisiones y brigadas y los profesores de las academias militares a todos niveles.
					
					El Comandante Supremo dirigio los ejercicios tras escuchar en el observatorio el parte sobre el plan de ejecucion de los mismos.
					
					Para burlar las barreras instaladas por las subunidades de zapadores de la gran unidad combinada 526 y abrir la ruta de avance de las subunidades motorizadas, los combatientes de la subunidad de infanteria ligera de la unidad combinada 478 asaltaron primero y ocuparon en un instante las zonas de defensa.
					
					Seguidamente, las subunidades encargadas de asegurar el avance emprendieron las acciones militares para destruir las barreras de diferentes tipos.
					
					Los cohetes antiaereos portatiles destruyeron con tiros certeros los "helicopteros" que llegaban para impedir el avance de las subunidades motorizadas mientras los canones autopropulsados abrieron el fuego simultaneo para golpear los blancos.
					
					Terminados los ejercicios, el Mariscal indico lo bueno y lo malo del entrenamiento y presento las tareas programaticas que serviran de guia en fortalecer el EPC como invencibles fuerzas armadas revolucionarias, al levantar la ola de ejercicios por el estilo de la guerrilla antijaponesa del monte Paektu.
					
					Al decir que los ejercicios de hoy tienen gran significado en la materializacion de la orientacion militar y estrategica del partido, instruyo organizar con frecuencia los entrenamientos de este tipo en el EPC porque asi los comandantes y los oficiales del Estado Mayor tendran que pensar mucho para ganar.
					
					Le acompanaron en esta ocasion el secretario del CC del PTC, Choe Ryong Hae, y el jefe de departamento del CC del PTC, O Il Jong.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam conversa con el presidente sudanes
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam conversa con el presidente sudanes
Pyongyang, 24 de octubre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, quien realiza una visita oficial y de amistad a la Republica de Sudan, converso el dia 23 en el palacio presidencial con el presidente de la Republica del Sudan, Omar Hassan Ahmed Al-Bashir.
					Ambas partes intercambiaron las opiniones sobre el tema de desarrollar las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises y otros de interes mutuo.
					
					En la ocasion participaron por la parte coreana, el ministro de Salud Publica Kang Ha Guk, el vicecanciller Kung Sok Ung, el viceministro de Relaciones Economicas con el Extranjero, So Kil Bok, el embajador coreano en Sudan, Kim Hyok Chol y otros miembros de la comitiva, y por la parte sudanesa, el presidente de la Asamblea Nacional, el canciller Ali Ahmed Karti, el presidente del Comite de Asuntos Diplomaticos de la Asamblea Nacional, el director para Asia Oriental del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores y otros miembros interesados.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam arriba a Jartum
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam arriba a Jartum
Pyongyang, 24 de octubre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, arribo el dia 23 a Jartum, capital de la Republica  de Sudan para realizar una visita oficial a este pais africano. 
					Le acompanaron el ministro de Salud Publica Kang Ha Guk, el vicecanciller Kung Sok Ung, el viceministro de Relaciones Economicas con el Extranjero, So Kil Bok, etc.
					
					En el aeropuerto donde flamean las banderas de Corea y Sudan, se ponia en fila la guardia de honor.
					
					El presidente y su comitiva fueron acogidos por el presidente de la Asamblea Nacional, el presidente del Comite de Asuntos Diplomaticos de la Asamblea Nacional, el director para Asia Oriental del MINREX y otros miembros concernientes y el embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la RPDC en Sudan, Kim Hyok Chol.
					
					Kim se dirigio a la residencia bajo la custodia de motocicletas.

articles.title: IRP publica carta blanca sobre lanzamiento de volantes anti-RPDC en Sur de Corea
articles.content:
IRP publica carta blanca sobre lanzamiento de volantes anti-RPDC en Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 24 de octubre (ACNC) -- El Instituto de la Reunificacion de la Patria (IRP) hizo publica el dia 24 una carta blanca para revelar el caracter criminal de la campana de lanzamiento de volantes de contenido anti-Republica Popular Democratica de Corea que lanzan en el suelo surcoreano Estados Unidos y los titeres surcoreanos instigando a las escorias humanas. 
					La nota revela que EE.UU. y la camarilla titere surcoreana son autores que empeoran la situacion causando el problema de volantes que agrava la confrontacion en la Peninsula Coreana y busca el peligro de guerra. 
					
					En la pasada guerra coreana, EE.UU. organizo las unidades de guerra psicologica adscritas a la Comandancia de las Fuerzas Norteamericanas en el Extremo Oriente y la Comandancia del octavo ejercito norteamericano y cometio el lanzamiento de volantes contra la RPDC. 
					
					Solo en enero de 1952, los uniformados norteamericanos esparcieron mas de 150 millones de volantes anti-RPDC. 
					
					Segun los datos publicados por ellos mismos, ascienden a mas de 2 mil 460 millones los volantes anti-RPDC lanzados durante 3 anos de la pasada guerra coreana, y se totalizan en mas de 4 mil millones sumando las octavillas esparcidas por el ejercito titere surcoreano. 
					
					El lanzamiento de volantes se torno mas intenso en el tiempo posbelico. 
					
					Bajo la instigacion de EE.UU., los titeres surcoreanos organizaron en las unidades del frente avanzado las unidades de guerra psicologica encargadas de lanzamiento de volantes. Y en la decada de 1970, cometieron hasta la "operacion de globos que transportan volantes" para lanzarlos a las zonas mas profundas de la retaguardia de la parte norcoreana. 
					
					Despues de publicada la historica Declaracion Conjunta del 4 de Julio en 1972, no dejaron de lanzar los volantes violando el acuerdo sobre el cese de calumnias reciprocas. 
					
					En la decada de 1980, instituyeron el nuevo destacamento de volantes para la guerra psicologica, subordinado a las fuerzas terrestres, y en 1991, lo ampliaron como "unidad del ejercito nacional" adscrito directamente al Ministerio de Defensa Nacional, de modo que se estableciera el sistema de mando unificado sobre el lanzamiento de volantes anti-RPDC. 
					
					Segun los datos sobre la "situacion actual de la guerra psicologica anti-Norte", presentado en 2011 a la "Asamblea Nacional" por el Ministerio de Defensa Nacional, el circulo militar surcoreano envio a la parte norcoreana mas de mil 918 millones de volantes desde la decada de 1980 hasta finales de la decada de 1990.
					
					Despues de aprobada la historica Declaracion Conjunta del 15 de Junio, las autoridades militares de ambas partes acordaron parar todas las formas de guerra psicologicas incluso el lanzamiento de volantes y los actos hostiles. Entonces, impotentes de hacerlo directamente, los titeres surcoreanos instigaron a lanzar volantes a los "fugitivos norcoreanos" y las entidades conservadoras y ultraderechistas. 
					
					En octubre de 2003, Ri Min Bok, disfrazado de representante de la "Asociacion de Cristianos Norcoreanos", cometio el lanzamiento de volantes anti-RPDC. Se sumaron luego al lanzamiento otras numerosas entidades como la "Direccion del Movimiento para la Democratizacion del Norte de Corea", la "Federacion de Movimiento por el Norte Libre", la "Federacion General de Entidades de Fugitivos Norcoreanos", la "Asociacion de Promocion de Democratizacion del Norte de Corea". 
					
					Esta campana se torno mas febril en el periodo de mandato del traidor Lee Myung Bak. 
					
					La banda de Lee invalido los acuerdos Norte-Sur de parar los actos hostiles incluso las calumnias reciprocas y presento el lanzamiento de volantes como tarea principal de la "politica sobre el Norte". 
					
					De esta manera, se reiniciaron la radiodifusion del ejercito titere surcoreano, el lanzamiento de volantes y otras formas de guerra psicologica anti-RPDC. Y se distribuyeron a las unidades en la primera linea del frente los equipos capaces de imprimir mas de 80 mil volantes al dia. 
					
					Un funcionario del ejercito surcoreano de aquel entonces confeso que "para la campana psicologica anti-RPDC en el tiempo de guerra tenemos archivados los manuscritos de volantes de mas de mil 300 generos y los de radiodifusion de mas de 470 generos". 
					
					En enero de 2011, la banda de Lee Myung Bak organizo en Chongwadae una orgia con mas de 20 fugitivos norcoreanos connotados, entre otros, el presidente del "Comite para la Democratizacion del Norte", Hong Sun Gyong, el presidente de la "Federacion General Mundial de Norcoreanos", An Chan Il, el representante de la "Solidaridad de Intelectuales NK", Kim Hung Gwang, y el representante de la "Federacion de Movimiento por el Norte Libre", Pak Sang Hak, y les prometio financiar el lanzamiento de volantes.
					
					Ademas, por el concepto de ayuda a los "fugitivos norcoreanos", asigno anualmente mas de 100 millones de US$. 
					
					Desde 2011 hasta julio de 2012, las autoridades surcoreanas entregaron 200 mil US$ del presupuesto para financiar el lanzamiento. 
					
					En el actual "poder" surcoreano, se torna mas brutal la campana de lanzamiento de volantes anti-RPDC. 
					
					Ya antes de su toma de posesion, en octubre de 2012, la mandataria surcoreana fue repudiada por la opinion publica por haber enviado el "mensaje de felicitacion" a la ceremonia de constitucion de la "Federacion por la Promocion de Democratizacion del Norte de Corea" integrada por los fugitivos norcoreanos que estaban al frente del lanzamiento de volantes anti-RPDC. Y despues de ser inquilina de Chongwadae, invito y estimulo a esas escorias humanas. 
					
					Ademas incorporo al "Comite de Gran Unidad del Pueblo" y al "Comite Preparatorio para la Unificacion", aparatos adscritos a la "presidenta", a las escorias humanas del "Comite para la Democratizacion del Norte", la "Solidaridad de Intelectuales NK", el "Centro de Estrategia sobre el Norte" y otras entidades intrigantes anti-RPDC.
					
					  La banda surcoreana les ofrece gratuitamente el aparato de navegacion por satelite a ser instalado en el globo de transporte de volantes, el programa que lo controla segun la direccion y velocidad del viento, y la tecnica capaz de transmitir los volantes electronicos hasta a la retaguardia de la parte norcoreana.
					
					  Aunque se acordo prohibir la censura a la contraparte en el primer contacto de alto nivel Norte-Sur efectuado en febrero, la horda conservadora surcoreana continuo el lanzamiento de volantes y pretende desarrollar y desplegar hasta el proyectil de lanzamiento de volantes de nuevo tipo para el canon autopropulsado K-9 con el fin de enviarlos mas lejos de la retaguardia norcoreana.
					
					  EE.UU. apoyo activamente el envio de volantes diciendo abiertamente que la campana psicologica como ese es el medio eficiente para desestabilizar y derrocar a la RPDC.
					
					  Especialmente, cuando se elevaba el ambiente de reconciliacion y reunificacion entre el Norte y el Sur despues del 15 de junio de 2000, fabrico la "comandancia combinada de la guerra psicologica" junto con el ejercito surcoreano y recurrio a la campana psicologica anti-RPDC introduciendo hasta el avion especial EC-130, llamado como "estacion radioemisora voladora", y la unidad de guerra psicologica.
					
					  Por otra parte, invento la "ley de libertad del Norte" con el objetivo del "cambio del regimen" de la RPDC y pone a los "fugitivos norcoreanos" al frente de la campana intrigante contra ella.
					
					  En abril de 2006 y en septiembre de 2008, el entonces presidente norteamericano Bush invito a EE.UU. a Kim Song Min, Pak Sang Hak y otras escorias humanas nombrados como representantes de las entidades intrigantes como la "Radio del Norte Libre" y la "Federacion de Movimiento por el Norte Libre" y los instigo al lanzamiento de volantes anti-RPDC elogiando que ellos son "vanguardias en la expansion de libertad".
					
					  En febrero de este ano, EE.UU. invito a Pak Sang Hak, Kang Chol Hwan, representante del "Centro de Estrategia sobre el Norte", y otros tipejos y les permitio visitar Silicon Valley para demostrarles la tecnica de enviar USB, DVD y otros medios electronicos a las zonas de la RPDC usando GPS.
					
					  Bajo la participacion de los fugitivos norcoreanos, organizo en escala internacional la "exposicion de tecnica de informaciones y comunicaciones para romper la red de informatica norcoreana" y les entrego en esa ocasion los datos de desarrollo de tecnicas de punta para la campana psicologica anti-RPDC.
					
					  Especialmente, anoto en OPLAN 5029 el parrafo de "derrocar al Norte de Corea al cambiar la concepcion de los habitantes norcoreanos a traves de las organizaciones no gubernamentales".
					
					  Para ponerlo en practica, ofrece cada ano enormes fondos a las entidades de los "fugitivos norcoreanos", que se dedican al lanzamiento, por conducto del Fondo Democratico Estatal, la Alianza por el Norte Libre, Human Rights Watch y otras organizaciones y entidades norteamericanas no gubernamentales.
					
					El "Fondo Democratico Estatal", que se dedica al derrocamiento del regimen de los Estados antiyanquis, aumenta cada ano el fondo de ayuda a las entidades de "fugitivos norcoreanos": un millon 210 mil US$ en 2007, un millon 270 mil US$ en 2008, un millon 400 mil US$ en 2009 y un millon 450 mil US$ en 2010 
					
					El Departamento de Estado de EE.UU. entrega todos los anos desde 2009 mas de un millon de US$ a las entidades como "Network por el Norte Democratico", "Radio para el Libre Norte de Corea" y la "Solidaridad de Norcoreanas Fugitivas para los DDHH".
					
					Asi EE.UU. proporciona cada ano a las escorias humanas mas de 20 millones de US$ y las instiga a calumniar y tergiversar en el Sur de Corea, EE.UU. y los escenarios de la ONU la maxima dignidad, el regimen y el estado de DDHH de la RPDC.
					
					Asimismo, los "fugitivos norcoreanos" de la "Direccion del Movimiento para la Democratizacion del Norte de Corea", la "Federacion de Movimiento por el Norte Libre", la "Asociacion de Cristianos Norcoreanos" y otras entidades intrigantes enviaron a la parte norcoreana mas de 10 millones de volantes como promedio anual.
					
					Los "fugitivos norcoreanos", que EE.UU. y los titeres surcoreanos describen como "luchadores por los DDHH", son la horda de criminales y basuras humanas que deben ser sancionados por la ley y por la sociedad.
					
					Son incontables las consecuencias catastroficas que produjo el lanzamiento de volantes de contenido anti-RPDC en las relaciones intercoreanas.
					
					La campana anti-RPDC de los "fugitivos norcoreanos", que se lanza bajo el amparo y el control de EE.UU. y las autoridades surcoreanas, es un acto en busca de guerra que viola el Acuerdo de Armisticio y los acuerdos Norte-Sur.
					
					EE.UU. debe sentirse avergonzado por el uso del dolar, que simboliza su poder, en los complots de esa chusma.
					
					EE.UU. y las autoridades titeres surcoreanas deben poner de inmediato fin al lanzamiento de volantes contra la RPDC teniendo presente sus consecuencias catastroficas.

articles.title: Ghulam Isaczai ofrece banquete por el dia de la ONU
articles.content:
Ghulam Isaczai ofrece banquete por el dia de la ONU
Pyongyang, 24 de octubre (ACNC) -- Con motivo del Dia de la ONU, el coordinador permanente de la ONU y representante permanente del Programa de las Naciones Unidas para el Desarrollo, Ghulam M. Isaczai, ofrecio el dia 24 un banquete. 
					Fueron invitados a la recepcion el vicecanciller Pak Myong Guk y otros funcionarios coreanos y los representantes diplomaticos de varios paises en Corea. 
					
					Estuvieron presentes los representantes de organizaciones internacionales acreditados en Corea.
					
					En la ocasion hubo discursos.

articles.title: Condecorados jugadores y entrenadores en RPDC
articles.content:
Condecorados jugadores y entrenadores en RPDC
Pyongyang, 24 de octubre (ACNC) -- Los exitos sorprendentes logrados por los jugadores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea en los XVII Juegos Asiaticos y los campeonatos mundiales son la gran victoria que exalta a todo el mundo la dignidad y el impetu de la nacion de Kim Il Sung y la Corea de Kim Jong Il y el resultado que trajeron el proyecto del Partido del Trabajo de Corea de construir potencia deportiva y su idea de dar importancia al deporte.
					El Mariscal Kim Jong Un ilumino la direccion y los remedios del desarrollo del deporte con la firme decision de poner en la posicion de potencia deportiva a la RPDC al levantar la ola de deporte en todo el pais y desarrollar rapidamente la tecnica deportiva asi como dirigio con energia las labores deportivas depositando gran confianza en los deportistas.
					
					Los fidedignos jugadores coreanos, que salieron a las competencias con la fidelidad al Mariscal y el patriotismo, vencieron a sus rivales con el coraje, tactica e indoblegable potencia espiritual, de manera que infundieran la conviccion en el triunfo y el optimismo en todos los militares y civiles y estimularan la lucha de ellos por construir una patria prospera.
					
					Fueron otorgados el Premio Kim Jong Il al pesista del Conjunto Deportivo 25 de Abril, Kim Un Guk, y al pesista del Conjunto Deportivo Amnokgang, Om Yun Chol; el titulo de Heroe del Trabajo de la RPDC al entrenador de futbol del Conjunto Deportivo 25 de Abril, Kim Kwang Min, el entrenador de levantamiento de pesas del mismo conjunto deportivo, Pak Ki Song, y a la futbolista del Conjunto Deportivo Amnokgang, Ra Un Sim; el titulo de Deportista del Pueblo, a la futbolista del Conjunto Deportivo 25 de Abril, Ho Un Byol, y la Orden Bandera Nacional de primera clase, al gimnasta del mismo conjunto deportivo, Ri Se Gwang.
					
					Fue publicado el dia 22 el decreto correspondiente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema.
